The oxygen levels in the atmosphere would drop significantly, leading to an increase in the rate of anaerobic respiration and potentially causing a shift in ecosystems.
Photosynthesis plays a crucial role in the carbon cycle, so without it, there would be a significant buildup of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere, contributing to climate change.
The energy flow in ecosystems would be disrupted, causing a ripple effect throughout the food web.
Many plants and algae would be unable to survive, leading to a decline in biodiversity.
The process of photosynthesis also produces oxygen, which is essential for most living organisms. Without it, many organisms would be unable to survive.
